page.title: 06The Golf Course, Kesgrave
page.content: Rushmere Heath Golf Course has been there for 86 years. At the present time 50-100 people use the golf course every day and the club has 750 members. It is not free to get into the club. Before anyone is accepted as a member he has to be interviewed then he has to pay an entering fee which is 75 Pounds. Each year every member has to pay a subscription fee of 117.50 Pounds apart from the first year of joining when they have to pay 190 Pounds. Non-members are allowed to play on a daily basis but they have to pay a Â£green fee' before they are allowed to play. The upkeep of the golf course is expensive with different machines for cutting the rough grass, the fairways and thee greens. Water sprinklers and fertilizers are also used to maintain the condition of the golf course.
